intro: Scutellaria molinarum, commonly known as the Molinarum blueflag, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the mint family, Lamiaceae, and is characterized by its square, hairy stems and opposite leaves. The plant produces small, tubular blue or violet flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Scutellaria molinarum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils, thriving in full sun to partial shade. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and wildflower displays.
